data.description: This course uses a social science approach to analyze theories of judicial decision making and to learn how law is made in a political context. Students will understand how the Supreme Court and justices operate in an interdependent political environment.
data.title: THE SUPREME COURT AS A POLITICAL INSTITUTION

data.description: Introduction to the legal process. Examination of the various concepts of law, the perennial problems of the law, legal reasoning, and the nature and function of law and the courts.
data.title: LAW, POLITICS AND SOCIETY

data.description: Basic institutions and processes of American government. The role of constitutional structures, parties, interest groups and elections in the system; policy formation and policy content.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO AMERICAN POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT

data.description: Basic institutions and processes of American government. The role of constitutional structures, parties, interest groups and elections in the system; policy formation and policy comment.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO AMERICAN POLITICS
